IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVES CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN AT-RISK SITUATIONS BY STRENGTHENING THEIR ABILITY TO SUCCEED IN LIFE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVES CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN AT-RISK SITUATIONS BY STRENGTHENING THEIR ABILITY TO SUCCEED IN LIFE.
IRS990.Description: SPECIAL EDUCATION - ON GROUNDS EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN. BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE PROVIDED 6,656 DAYS OF EDUCATION DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.

Activity2.Description: FOSTER CARE PROGRAM - RECRUIT, TRAIN AND LICENSE FOSTER PARENTS AND PLACE DCF CHILDREN IN FOSTER HOMES. BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVED 81 CHILDREN DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.

Activity3.Description: KIDS INN - A SHORT-TERM THERAPEUTIC RESIDENCE DESIGNED TO PROVIDE THE BRIDGE BACK TO THE HOME AND COMMUNITY. BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVED 47 CHILDREN DURING YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.

ActivityOther.Description: SAFE HAVEN - PROVIDES IMMEDIATE, OVERNIGHT CARE TO CHILDREN UPON A 24 HOUR, 365 DAY PER YEAR ADMISSION CAPACITY. BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVED 53 CHILDREN DURING YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.

INTENSIVE FAMILY PRESERVATION - INTENSIVE INTERVENTIONS PROVIDED IN THE HOMES OF CHILDREN WITH EMOTIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL PROBLEMS. BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVED 121 FAMILIES DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.
DAY TREATMENT - CO-EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN WHO ARE EXHIBITING EMOTIONAL AND LEARNING DIFFICULTIES. BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVED 136 CHILDREN DURING YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.

FAST PROGRAM - DESIGNED TO ASSIST IN THE PRESERVATION OF FOSTER AND ADOPTIVE HOMES, THEREBY REDUCING THE NUMBER OF PLACEMENTS EXPERIENCED BY CHILDREN. BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVED 93 CHILDREN DURING YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.

IICAPS -COMMUNITY BASED SERVICES PROVIDED TO CHILDREN WITH SERIOUS DISORDERS IN THEIR HOMES TO PREVENT HOPITALIZATIONS THROUGH CRISIS INTERVENTION. 157 CHILDREN WERE SERVED DURING THE YEAR END JUNE 30, 2010.
OTHER PROGRAMS INCLUDE ISP, TRAINING AND OTHERS ALL OF WHICH PROVIDED VARIOUS SERVICES TO CHILDREN DURING YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.
FAMILY SUPPORT TEAM - TARGETS A population of CHILDREN IN NEED OF INTENSIVE, COMPREHENSIVE & INTEGRATED SERVICES. BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVED 70 CHILDREN DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.
CLINIC - BOYS & GIRLS VILLAGE SERVED 305 CHILDREN DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30,2010.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part IV, Supplemental Information: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION FOR OTHER INCOME: YEAR 2005 2006 2007 2008 2009 FUNDRAISING EVENTS 109,537 133,788 177,758 140,034 163,022 MISCELLANEOUS 1,890 540 1,490 TOTAL 111,427 134,328 179,248 140,034 163,022

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Gaffney, Bennett and Associates, Inc. has been retained by Boys & Girls Village to handle its relations with State of Connecticut officials in an effort to enable The Organization to accomplish its mission. This includes meetings with legislative leaders, commissioners, and the Governor's office.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: STEPHEN JOFFE, C.E.O. FOR PART OF THE YEAR, RECEIVED SEVERANCE COMPENSATION DURING THE FISCAL YEAR OF $50,000.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DIRECTORS RALPH CARLONI AND GINA HART HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FULL BOARD RECEIVES A COPY OF THE 990 TO REVIEW. IT IS DISCUSSED AT THE SUBSEQUENT BOARD MEETING AND FILED UPON BOARD APPROVAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT IN WHICH THEY AGREE TO DISCLOSE ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST TO OTHER BOARD MEMBERS AND THAT THEY WILL NOT VOTE OR USE THEIR PERSONAL INFLUENCE WHEN A POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. ALL NEW BOARD MEMBERS ARE NOTIFIED OF THE POLICY AND INDICATE THEIR AGREEMENT BY SIGNING THE POLICY STATEMENT. THE POLICY IS REVIEWED AND UPDATED ANNUALLY AS NEEDED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD REVIEWS COMPARABILITY DATA IN DETERMINING THE CEO'S COMPENSATION. THE SALARY IS DETERMINED, REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE FULL BOARD. THE CEO ESTABLISHES COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE AGENCY'S ANNUAL REPORT AND THE PUBLICLY FILED 990. THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
